rule-23-2-a.test_description: System 7 baseline has a SAT reset correctly set to 5 delta F

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the SAT is reset higher by 5F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-2-b.test_description: System 7 baseline has a has SAT reset but not correctly set to 5 delta F

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the SAT is reset higher by 5F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-2-c.test_description: System 7 baseline has a does not have SAT reset

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the SAT is reset higher by 5F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-3-a.test_description: The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is acceptably exactly 30% of primary airflow in both terminals

standard.rule_description: System 5, 7, 6, 8 minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-3-b.test_description: The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is acceptably greater than 30% of primary airflow in both terminals

standard.rule_description: System 5, 7, 6, 8 minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-3-c.test_description: The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is incorrectly less than 30% of primary airflow in both terminals

standard.rule_description: System 5, 7, 6, 8 minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-6-a.test_description: VAV fans in system 6 are correctly sized to 50% of peak design load  with a performance efficiency of 0.35 W/cfm

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, Fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall be sized for 50% of the peak design primary air (from the VAV air-handling unit) flow rate and shall be modeled with 0.35 W/cfm fan power.

rule-23-6-b.test_description: VAV fans in system 6 are neither sized to 50% of peak design load  nor and have performance efficiency of greater than 0.35 W/cfm

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, Fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall be sized for 50% of the peak design primary air (from the VAV air-handling unit) flow rate and shall be modeled with 0.35 W/cfm fan power.

rule-23-7-a.test_description: System 6's fan system correctly specified temperature control as constant

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8,  supply air temperature setpoint shall be constant at the design condition

rule-23-7-b.test_description: System 6's fan system incorrectly specified temperature control as outside air reset

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8,  supply air temperature setpoint shall be constant at the design condition

rule-23-8-a.test_description: System 7's VAV fan follows the part load vav fan power as defined by method 1 in Table G3.1.3.15

standard.rule_description: System 5-8 and 11 - part load vav fan power shall be modeled using either method 1 or 2 in Table G3.1.3.15.

rule-23-8-b.test_description: System 7's VAV fan does not follow the part load vav fan power defined by method 1 in Table G3.1.3.15

standard.rule_description: System 5-8 and 11 - part load vav fan power shall be modeled using either method 1 or 2 in Table G3.1.3.15.

rule-23-16-a.test_description: System 7's preheat coil is correctly controlled to 20 F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint

standard.rule_description: Systrems 5 - 8, the baseline system shall be modeled with preheat coils controlled to a fixed set point 20F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint.

rule-23-16-b.test_description: System 7's preheat coil is incorrectly controled to only 13 F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint. Should be 20 F.

standard.rule_description: Systrems 5 - 8, the baseline system shall be modeled with preheat coils controlled to a fixed set point 20F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint.
